result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paula J Sneen

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Conditions:
No contact with T.J. Maxx Store, D.J. unless in their official capacity.
No acts/threats of violence toward anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
(Covers 22CF439, 22CM272, 22CM49)

(Cases 22CM49, 22CM272, 22CF439 are called at 11:15 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Paula Sneen appears in custody via video conference from the Dunn County Jail. Attorney Robert Thorson appears in person. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants executed. State requests $500 cash bond- notes failures to appear in cases as well as other counties. Defendant requests signature bonds remain. Court orders $500 cash bond to cover all 3 cases with various conditions. 
Hearing in all 3 cases: 11/17/2022 at 10:00 AM (IN PERSON).
Return on warrant on October 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.

(1:38 PM cases 22CM49, 22CM272, 22CF439 called.) Defendant Paula J Sneen does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Paula J Sneen. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Thorson was able to get in contact with the defendant's sister who advises the last contact with the defendant was on August 31, 2022 and the defendant may be residing in Menomonie and does not have a phone.
Attorney Thorson has no further information regarding the defendant's whereabouts.
State requests warrants. Court orders warrants.
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with any T.J. Maxx store. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with D.J. unless in their official capacity. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
(Covers 22CM49, 22CM272, and 22CF439)
Hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Conditions:
No contact with any T.J. Maxx store. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with D.J. unless in their official capacity. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
(Covers 22CM49, 22CM272, and 22CF439)

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
(11:04 AM cases 22CM49, 22CM272, 22CF439 called.) Defendant Paula J Sneen in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Paula J Sneen. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Thorson advises a review was done and has reviewed the report with the defendant.
Attorney Thorson advises the defendant agrees with the findings of the report.
State has no objection and stipulates to the findings of the report.
Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed.
State requests the cash bond remain in place. Defendant advises is unable to post any cash.
State advises with the information the defendant is unable to post any cash, requests to convert the bond to a $5,000.00 signature bond with all conditions remaining the same. 
Court orders the bond is converted to a $5,000.00 signature bond with all conditions remaining in effect.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 9 am in person.
Competency hearing on August 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

*CONFIDENTIAL*
by Kristin Johnson, Psy.D., dated 08/18/2022
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
of Commitment for Treatment

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
(Cases called at 3:53 PM - 22CF439, 22CM49, 22CM272)
Defendant Paula Sneen appears in custody with Attorney Robert Thorson.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties stipulate to the report and the findings that the Defendant is not competent to proceed but is likely to regain competency.  59 days of credit on all 3 cases.  State is not requesting the involuntary administration of medication and would leave that up to the institution to determine.  Court finds that the Defendant is incompetent, and will not make an order regarding medication based on reasons stated on the record.  Cases are suspended.  State moves to seal the report of Dr. Minter - so ordered.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Dr. Donna Minter may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 06/09/2022.
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely
Request to Appear Remotely

*CONFIDENTIAL*
 by Dr. Donna Minter, dated 06/02/2022
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on June 9, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Competency hearing on May 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Conditions
No contact with any T.J. Maxx store. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with D.J. unless in their official capacity. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
(Covers 22CM49, 22CM272, and 22CF439)

(Cases 22CF439, 22CM49, 22CM272 are called at 9:33 AM- by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paula J Sneen appeared by video, in custody from Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek appears in person on behalf of Attorney Robert Thorson. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint in 22CF439. Court advises the Defendant of the charges and potential penalties. State requests $200 cash bond in 22CM49 and 22CM272 be extended to 22CF439 as well. Defense requests signature bond. Court orders $200 cash bond in 22CM49 and 22CM272 be extended to 22CF439 with additional conditions. 
State raises competency concerns. Court orders competency examination by DHS. Branch 3 Judicial Assistant to schedule Competency Hearing.
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Case called at 11:11 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Paula Sneen appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Raymond. ADA Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court adjourns initial appearance due to the Defendant's current circumstances. 
Initial Appearance: 04/18/2022 at 11:00 AM.
